content.question: The figure shows two positively charged particles, with charges <math alttext="positive q" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>+</mo><mi>q</mi></mpadded></math> and <math alttext="positive 2 q" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>q</mi></mpadded></math>. Also shown are equipotential lines, which are spaced at equal intervals <math alttext="delta V" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Î”</mi><mi>V</mi></math>. A small negatively charged particle begins at the top of the diagram with initial velocity <math alttext="v sub 0" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>. As the particle follows the path shown by the dashed line, at which point does the negatively charged particle have the greatest kinetic energy?

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
